abstract: All of the strategies typically employed  at the behest of activist investors rely on cheap capital, but that financing is vanishing.
snippet: All of the strategies typically employed  at the behest of activist investors rely on cheap capital, but that financing is vanishing.
lead_paragraph: RATTLING the saber won’t be good enough,” Carl C. Icahn, the colorful investor who has made billions of dollars aiming at corporate America with vitriolic shake-up and breakup campaigns, lamented to me last week. “It’s going to be somewhat more difficult.”

headline.main: Will the Credit Crisis End the Activists’ Run?
headline.print_headline: Will the Credit Crisis End the Activists’ Run?
